Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Fez \Fez\ (f[e^]z), n. [F., fr. the town of Fez in Morocco.] A felt or cloth cap, usually red and having a tassel, -- a variety of the tarboosh. See {Tarboosh}. --B. Taylor. [1913 Webster]
Fez n 1: a city in north central Morocco; religious center [syn: {Fes}] 2: a felt cap (usually red) for a man; shaped like a flat-topped cone with a tassel that hangs from the crown [syn: {tarboosh}]
